abstract: Tell us about the gender roles in your house. Who would you say does most of the "parenting," whether that means helping with homework, cooking meals, attending school functions or just being home most often--and whether it's done by a mother or father, or by a sibling, grandparent or someone else?

headline.main: How Do Male and Female Roles Differ in Your Family?

snippet: Tell us about the gender roles in your house. Who would you say does most of the "parenting," whether that means helping with homework, cooking meals, attending school functions or just being home most often--and whether it's done by a mother or f...
lead_paragraph: A recent Motherlode post about how the U.S. Census Bureau considers mothers the "designated parent" inspired us to ask this question. Who would you say does most of the "parenting" in your house (even if that person is neither a mother nor a father, but a grandparent, sibling or someone else)? Who does most of the housework? To what extent do the roles in your house seem to fall along traditional gender lines? Why?
abstract: Tell us about the gender roles in your house. Who would you say does most of the "parenting," whether that means helping with homework, cooking meals, attending school functions or just being home most often--and whether it's done by a mother or father, or by a sibling, grandparent or someone else?

headline.main: How Do Male and Female Roles Differ in Your Family?

snippet: Intersex is a group of conditions where there is a discrepancy between the external genitals and the internal genitals (the testes and ovaries). The older term for this condition, hermaphroditism, came from joining the names of a Greek god and god...
lead_paragraph: Intersex is a group of conditions where there is a discrepancy between the external genitals and the internal genitals (the testes and ovaries). The older term for this condition, hermaphroditism, came from joining the names of a Greek god and goddess, Hermes and Aphrodite. Hermes was a god of male sexuality (among other things) and Aphrodite a goddess of female sexuality, love, and beauty. Although the older terms are still included in this article for reference, they have been replaced by most experts (and patients and families) because they are misleading, confusing, and insensitive. Increasingly this group of conditions is being called disorders of sex development (DSDs).

headline.main: Intersex

snippet: The normal amount of body hair for women varies. Most of the time, a woman only has fine hair, or peach fuzz, above the lips and on the chin, chest, abdomen, or back. If you have coarse, dark hairs in these areas, the condition is called hirsutism...
lead_paragraph: The normal amount of body hair for women varies. Most of the time, a woman only has fine hair, or peach fuzz, above the lips and on the chin, chest, abdomen, or back. snippet: To the Editor:   Re "Companies Merge; Families Break Up" (Op-Ed, Sept. 3): Lester C. Thurow correctly points out that the decline in men's wages is a major cause of family change. But he implies that the answer to family break-up and child neglect...
lead_paragraph: To the Editor: Re "Companies Merge; Families Break Up" (Op-Ed, Sept. 3): Lester C. Thurow correctly points out that the decline in men's wages is a major cause of family change. But he implies that the answer to family break-up and child neglect is to shore up male wages and restore the "traditional" family. While better jobs for all is a desirable goal, returning to a system of male breadwinning is an unworkable and, for many families, undesirable solution.

headline.main: Corporate Giants Tighten Their Hold on U.S.; Homemaker Nostalgia

snippet: Princess Kiko will give birth by Caesarean section on Wednesday morning, the Imperial Household Agency announced, amid hopes that the royal family might produce its first male heir in four decades. The gender of the baby has not been disclosed to ...
lead_paragraph: Princess Kiko will give birth by Caesarean section on Wednesday morning, the Imperial Household Agency announced, amid hopes that the royal family might produce its first male heir in four decades. The gender of the baby has not been disclosed to the public, but conservatives hope it will be a boy, thereby scuttling debate over whether to change Japan’s male-only succession law to allow a woman to take the throne. Kiko, 39, is married to Prince Akishino, the second son of Emperor Akihito. A male baby would be third in line to the throne, after Crown Prince Naruhito and Akishino.

headline.main: Japan: The Country Circles Wednesday

snippet: LEAD: The California Department of Food and Agriculture said today that it had caught the first African pumpkin fly found in North America. The male fly, of the species Dacus bivittatus, was found Monday in a plum tree in Cerritos, Calif. The fly,...
lead_paragraph: LEAD: The California Department of Food and Agriculture said today that it had caught the first African pumpkin fly found in North America. The male fly, of the species Dacus bivittatus, was found Monday in a plum tree in Cerritos, Calif. The fly, widespread in Africa south of the Sahara, is a pest of the gourd family - squash, melons and pumpkins - and of tomatoes and papayas.

headline.main: African Fruit Fly Is Found

snippet: The po'ouli bird, one of the rarest birds on earth, came closer to being wiped out when a male, one of the last three believed to exist, died in captivity late Friday, the Fish and Wildlife Service said. The remaining two po'ouli, believed to be a...
lead_paragraph: The po'ouli bird, one of the rarest birds on earth, came closer to being wiped out when a male, one of the last three believed to exist, died in captivity late Friday, the Fish and Wildlife Service said. The remaining two po'ouli, believed to be a male and a female, have not been seen for nearly a year. The state and the Fish and Wildlife Service began a search to find the remaining two po'ouli in the remote rainforests of Maui. The po'ouli, part of the Hawaiian honeycreeper family, is so unusual it has its own genus. It is possible the po'ouli that died Friday was the last one, making it a rare circumstance when scientists were able to document the moment a species became extinct.
abstract: Male po'ouli bird dies in captivity in Hawaii; it is one of last three believed to exist; remaining two, one male and one female, have not been seen for year, so it is possible that there are none left at all (S)

headline.main: National Briefing | West: Hawaii: Rare Bird Dies
